page.title: 18SUNDAYS,KIRKCOWAN 1925
page.content: On {Sundays}most children went to church four times a-day, twice to Sunday School and twice to services. {Sunday School}was at 10am and 3pm and services were at noon and 7pm.To go to church the children wore their Sunday clothes and girls always wore button up boots,hats and gloves.These clothes were only worn on a Sunday.Some people went to the {Band of Hope}on a Thursday.Sometimes if there was a naughty boy sitting next to a girl he would pull the elastic on her hat, let it go and she would scream then was given a row for making a noise in {church.}Girls had a hat for winter and one for summer.In Sunday school they sang {psalms}and were taught {Bible} stories .They would learn to recite parts of the Bible.
